qas.question: What part of the telephone was investigated by the patent officer?
When did Bell put in his prior patent?
What liquid did Bell use in his first application?

context: The question of priority for the <a0_0>variable resistance<a0_0/> feature of the telephone was raised by the examiner before he approved Bell's patent application. He told Bell that his claim for the variable resistance feature was also described in Gray's caveat. Bell pointed to a variable resistance device in Bell's previous application in which Bell described a cup of <a2_0>mercury<a2_0/>, not water. Bell had filed the mercury application at the patent office a year earlier on <a1_0>February 25, 1875<a1_0/>, long before Elisha Gray described the water device. In addition, Gray abandoned his caveat, and because he did not contest Bell's priority, the examiner approved Bell's patent on March 3, 1876. Gray had reinvented the variable resistance telephone, but Bell was the first to write down the idea and the first to test it in a telephone.
